name: heterochromia
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a condition in which the eyes are different colours: The actor has heterochromia: her left eye is blue and her right eye is green. Heterochromia can be the result of trauma.
More examplesFewer examplesIn some cases, heterochromia can be a sign of another condition.Heterochromia is a condition which causes different colours in the irises.There are three types of heterochromia.Other, less common presenting signs include cataract, differences in pupil size or iris colour (heterochromia), or bulging of one or both eyes.It is likely that his heterochromia was genetically inherited.
